column3: ACK, unless standard markdown renders it ugly. Looks okay as plaintext.\n

I've always found it a drawback of markdown, compared to RestructuredText, that there is no way to do tables without ugly inline HTML.

This looks nice in the github rendered output:
https://github.com/torstehu/bitcoin/blob/17cecbe9b98ed140b61a2336a8339acc248849b2/doc/build-unix.md

No idea how 'standard markdown' shows this, I highly doubt anyone is using an actual markdown viewer on any of
Added e36a1d9fe63a850e036c4fa1924cc810288dddce to make table heading neat after suggestion by @drak\n

ACK on changes
Please squash into one commit (git rebase -i).
I also see that both of your commits have different author information.
Commits squashed into one and author info corrected, thanks :)\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/a75cacdac4e183fb1156f8d511d989233b774a9d for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
You can make this a continuous line of `-------------|--------------|---------------` so it looks more neat as plaintext and it will still render correctly as markdown.\n
